intro: Cordia americana, commonly known as the American cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the southeastern United States. It features smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive species within the Boraginaceae family. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
